Study","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":3,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":4,"length":23,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6df8t","text":"The study titled, \"Relationship between Instructional Resources and Academic Performance of Business Studies Students in Public Junior Secondary Schools, Abeokuta South Local Government Area, Ogun State, Nigeria\" aims to investigate the extent to which instructional resources impact the academic performance of business studies students in public junior secondary schools in Abeokuta South Local Government Area, Ogun State, Nigeria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"408b7","text":"For realization of good performance in a school, teaching and learning resources must be put in place and used effectively in classroom practice. According to Omambe as cited in Ajoke (2017), asserts that instructional materials are central in the teaching and learning of pupils because they are used to compliment efficiency of a teacher and effectiveness in lesson development. The study seeks to provide insights into the relationship between instructional resources and academic performance, which can help policymakers and educators to develop effective strategies to improve the quality of education.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vo5s","text":"Onuoha and Ezeudu (2021) found that instructional resources significantly influence the academic performance of secondary school students in Nigeria. Another study by Abdu-Raheem et al. (2021) investigated the effect of instructional resources on the academic performance of students in Mathematics and Science subjects in Nigerian secondary schools and found that adequate provision of instructional resources positively affects academic performance of students. Oluwagbohunmi and Abdu-Raheem as cited in Ajoke (2017) acknowledged that teaching and learning resources are such materials used by teachers to aid explanations and make learning of subject matter understandable to students during teaching and learning process.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bngf9","text":"The influence of instructional resources in promoting studentsâ€™ good academic performance in Business Studies in junior secondary schools is indisputable. The materials used by teachers to teach and drive home their subject points at the junior secondary school levels of our education system is incontrovertibly a paramount issue in practical classroom interaction and successful transfer of knowledge from the teacher to the learners. As earlier mentioned, instructional resources are materials which assist teachers to make their lessons explicit to learners. They are also used to transmit information, ideas and notes to learners.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"u60j","text":"Business studies is offered at the junior secondary levels where pre-vocational and vocational subjects are offered. At this level, students offer business studies as an integrated subject, while at the senior secondary level, subjects such as Bookkeeping/Accounting, Economics, Store Keeping, Commerce, Typewriting/Keyboarding, Computer Studies, Shorthand, Office Practice and Marketing are offered as Business Education. According to Obidile and Eze (2018), Business studies is a subject designed to equip the learners with the necessary competencies needed for exposure into the world of business. The authors maintained that the subject exposes the students to business practices so that they could respond positively to economic realities. It equips the students with the administrative and managerial competencies needed to adapt to the economic situations. If the objectives of Business studies are to be maximally achieved, the school system should integrate instructional materials in the teaching and learning of Business studies. Factors such as adequacy, availability and utilization of instructional materials should be properly addressed. It is expected that students who had offered Business studies should be able to demonstrate to a reasonable degree the skills needed for self-employment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hjo8","text":"It is worrisome that some of the students of business studies could not demonstrate the required skills needed to perform well in their terminal results and also for self-employment. This could mean that the teachersâ€™ roles in the classroom might have failed to equip the learners with the expected skills. This could be probably due to non-use of instructional materials in the teaching of Business studies. Instructional materials, no matter their nature and composition, constitute important and relevant components of successful teaching and learning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enre","text":"To make the teaching process effectual in public junior secondary schools in","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ck45i","text":"Abeokuta South Local Government Area of Ogun State, so many resources should be made available. These resources are also known as teaching and learning aids. According to Oladapo (2021), the resources can be categorised in different ways as: traditional teaching and learning resources and modern teaching and learning resources. The classifications can be further broken down as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gbf4","text":"Traditional and Modern Instructional Resources: This categorization divides instructional resources into two categories: traditional resources, which have been used for a long time, and modern resources, which are relatively new. Examples of traditional resources include textbooks, chalkboards, and paper-based materials, while modern resources include computers, multimedia tools, and online resources. Oladapo (2021).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ci7e","text":"According to Lawrence (2017), audio resources include lectures, speeches, and podcasts; visual resources include images, charts, diagrams, and videos, and audio-visual resources include multimedia presentations and animations.Audio, Visual, and Audio-Visual Instructional Resources: This categorization divides instructional resources based on their modality.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7668r","text":"Human and Non-Human Instructional Resources: This categorization divides instructional resources into two categories: human resources, which include teachers and other human instructors, and non-human resources, which include materials, technology, and equipment, Ambogo (2012).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29maa","text":"Conventional and Non-Conventional Instructional Resources: According to Shikha (2018), this categorization divides instructional resources into two categories: conventional resources, which are commonly used in schools, and non-conventional resources, which are not commonly used in schools. Examples of conventional resources include textbooks and chalkboards, while examples of non-conventional resources include simulations and games.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6v6n9","text":"Effective teaching of business studies in junior secondary schools is critical for the development of a skilled workforce that can contribute to the economic growth of the nation. Instructional resources such as textbooks, computers, internet, and audio-visual aids can enhance teaching and learning experiences, but the availability and utilization of these resources in public junior secondary schools in Abeokuta South Local Government Area of Ogun State is unclear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amp7a","text":"Some factors have been identified as enhancers to effective teaching in the context of the relationship between instructional resources and effective teaching of business studies in public junior secondary schools in Abeokuta South Local Government Area of Ogun State. Here are some of them:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68r93","text":"Availability and adequacy of instructional resources: The availability and adequacy of instructional resources can enhance effective teaching. According to Ogundele and Ogunyemi (2018), instructional resources are important for teaching and learning. They help to create an enabling environment for effective teaching and enhance the learning outcomes of students. Therefore, the provision of adequate and appropriate instructional resources such as textbooks, computers, projectors, and other teaching aids can facilitate effective teaching.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qp03","text":"According to Akinola and Aremu (2021), instructional resources refer to materials or tools used in teaching and learning. The availability of adequate instructional resources such as textbooks, computers, projectors, and other relevant materials can enhance effective teaching.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fer2","text":"Teacher competence: Teacher competence is another factor that can enhance effective teaching. Teachers who are knowledgeable and skilled in their subject matter can deliver quality instruction and promote effective learning. According to Oyebola and Adeoye (2020), teacher competence is crucial for effective teaching. They argue that teachers who are competent in their subject matter are more likely to use instructional resources effectively.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp571","text":"According to Adeleke (2021), The competence of teachers in the subject matter and pedagogy is another factor that can enhance effective teaching. Teachers who are competent in the subject matter can deliver the content effectively to their students.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ja31","text":"The Use of technology: The use of technology can enhance effective teaching. According to Olaleye and Adetunji (2019), technology can be used to enhance the teaching and learning process. They argue that technology can help to create an interactive and engaging learning environment. The use of technology such as multimedia presentations, educational software, and online resources can help to improve the effectiveness of teaching.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1aqm","text":"The use of technology in teaching can also enhance effective teaching. According to (Adetunji et al., 2021), the use of technology such as multimedia resources and educational software can make learning more engaging and interactive.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7l7k","text":"Teacher training and professional development: Teacher training and professional development can enhance effective teaching. According to Adekunle and Adu (2021), teacher training and professional development are important for improving the quality of teaching. They argue that training can help teachers to acquire new knowledge and skills, and to use instructional resources effectively.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rshl","text":"The use of effective teaching methods such as inquiry-based learning and cooperative learning can enhance effective teaching. According to a study by (Adedeji et al., 2021), the use of inquiry-based learning had a significant effect on the effective teaching of business studies in secondary schools in Nigeria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lp65","text":"Student engagement: Student engagement is another factor that can enhance effective teaching. They argue that teachers who engage students in the learning process are more likely to promote effective learning outcomes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7kin","text":"The relationship between teachers and students can impact effective teaching. This study therefore, sought to investigate the relationship between instructional resources and academic performance of business studies students in public junior secondary schools, Abeokuta South Local Government Area, Ogun State, Nigeria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ac3b9","text":"1.2\tStatement of the Problem","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":28,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"buuqt","text":"Since the inception of the National Junior Secondary School Business Studies Curriculum in Nigeria, few studies have been devoted to evaluating the utilization of instructional materials and resources in the teaching of business studies in Junior Secondary Schools.
